Hello I'm new to Heritrix. I've been trying to modify Heritrix
(Frontier, P=
rocessor) for three weeks, but I've never succeed in getting
it to
run. Her=
e is the workflow that I need.

1. Frontier is initialized. It doesn't sche=
dule all the seeds, but only
the first one.
2. Processors are initialized (=
as usuall).
3. ToeThread takes this one scheduled seed and starts to run. T=
he other
ToeThreads wait, because there are no scheduled seeds.(as usuall)
=
4. This seed goes through the processor chain. All retrieved links are
swit=
ched to CandidateURI and are scheduled (as usuall)
5. ToeThreads can take t=
hese candidateURIs from Frontier by the method
next() and they start to run=
 (as usuall)
6. The processor (SimpleProcessor) I wrote on my own, manages =
the STOP
condition.
7. When this processor sets the STOP condition as TRUE,=
 the following
situations should happen
- all running ToeThreads must stop =
and all CandidateURIs must be deleted
- Maybe processors need to be reseted=
 ??? ( I am not sure if it si
needed)
- SimpleProcessor must set the STOP c=
ondition to FALSE (reset STOP
condition)
- Frontier must now load the secon=
d seed and schedule it.
8. repeat process from step 3.

Summary:
I need cra=
wling the seeds one after the other. My SimpleProcessor must
detect
when to=
 stop crawling the actual seed.

<DIV align=3D"left">Hello I'm new to Heritrix. I've been trying to modify H=
eritrix <BR>(Frontier, Processor) for three weeks, but I've never succeed i=
n getting it to <BR>run. Here is the workflow that I need.<BR><BR>1. Fronti=
er is initialized. It doesn't schedule all the seeds, but only the first on=
e.<BR>2. Processors are initialized (as usuall).<BR>3. ToeThread takes this=
 one scheduled seed and starts to run. The other ToeThreads wait, because t=
here are no scheduled seeds.(as usuall)<BR>4. This seed goes through the pr=
ocessor chain. All retrieved links are switched to CandidateURI and are sch=
eduled (as usuall)<BR>5. ToeThreads can take these candidateURIs from Front=
ier by the method next() and they start to run (as usuall)<BR>6. The proces=
sor (SimpleProcessor) I wrote on my own, manages the STOP condition.<BR>7. =
When this processor sets the STOP condition as TRUE, the following situatio=
ns should happen<BR>	- all running ToeThreads must stop and all CandidateUR=
Is must be deleted<BR>	- Maybe processors need to be reseted ??? ( I am not=
 sure if it si needed) <BR>	- SimpleProcessor must set the STOP condition t=
o FALSE (reset STOP condition)<BR>	- Frontier must now load the second seed=
 and schedule it.<BR>8. repeat process from step 3.<BR><BR><STRONG>Summary:=
</STRONG><BR>I need crawling the seeds one after the other. My SimpleProces=
sor must detect<BR>when to stop crawling the actual seed.<BR><BR></DIV><BR>=
<BR>
